result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Jerome Bremer

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Joshua Jerome Bremer

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua Jerome Bremer
Current: 200 South 9th ST, Cameron, WI 54822 United States  (Effective: 02-24-2020)
Prior: 3390 Big McGraw, Danbury, WI 54830 United States

Defendant, Joshua Jerome Bremer, appeared with Attorney James McLaughlin.  Attorney William Lund Norine appeared for the State. Atty. McLaughlin addresses the Court, Waiver of PH and plead G to County 1 of this case, all other cases/charges DRI, $200 in restitution has been paid, $10 to be paid in 30 days. State addresses the Court re: restitution in the FE case. Recess for DA to obtain information in 16CF203, Waive of Right to PH in this case as well. Receives treatment for mental illness. Atty M. believes his client is fully capable to proceed. The Court finds Def. Competent.   Court informs def. of rights to PH; Waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information for both cases, waives reading. Pleading G to two counts of poss. of Meth. 15CF73 restitution. The Court is in receipt of PLQ. The State addresses the Court RE Victim Rights (VRC) in 16CF203 Count 1 and 17CF97 Count 1 Def. enters G pleas, the Court finds FB for Pleas and finds him Comp. and enter JOC. The State readdresses the Court, requests the Court to adopt the resolution.  The Court reexamines Def. RE his pleading to FE and further rights and reg. to pleas. (deportation)  Atty McLaughlin readdresses the Court and also requests the Court to adopt the resolution. Def. enters aloqution.   The Court withholds sentence, 2 years probation, $10 to be paid w/in 2 weeks, AODA, take all meds as prescribed by physician, GED or equivelant, $518 per count DOC to collect $25/mo or if a higher amount is determined. Court orders DNA and FE charge restrictions.
